byline.contributor: Mitch Smith contributed reporting. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

abstract: Wayne County Court Judge Brian Sullivan vacates murder convictions of Davontae Sanford and orders him released from prison; Sanford, who confessed at age 14 to shooting four people in Detroit before recanting, spent nine years in jail even after hit man admitted to killings.
lead_paragraph: Davontae Sanford was serving up to 90 years for four killings in Detroit even though he did not match descriptions of the killers and a hit man later admitted to the crime.

headline.main: Man in Detroit Who Confessed to Killings at Age 14, Then Recanted, Is Ordered Freed
headline.print_headline: Man Who Confessed to Killings When He Was 14 Is Ordered Freed

snippet: Davontae Sanford was serving up to 90 years for four killings in Detroit even though he did not match descriptions of the killers and a hit man later admitted to the crime.
